concept.title: 2013 Technical Publications Highlights
concept.shortdesc: Technical Publications (product documentation) team achievements for 2013.

section.title: Redesigned Marketing Cloud Help
section.p: We have improved the Help Home with a redesign in 2013:

ul.li: Product interface: Redesigned the Help Home so that clients view product documentation as a Marketing Cloud solution.

Search: Implemented search in the Help drop-down. Faster access to help, robust searches.
Search encompasses Help, Global Services (community and KB support), and AEM CQ instances.
Implemented Search&Promote as the search engine.
Rebrand: Rebranded all content to align with solutions and capabilities. Delivered on release day.

Authoring:
Met deliverable milestones for all new feature documentation.
Increased overall writer productivity and publishing capability by 5 - 10% after revamping internal publishing tools and processes.
Unified content from acquisition (Satellite, Context Optional), and various authoring environments (CQ, RoboHelp).
Provided tool and publishing support to PrimeTime and Media Optimizer authoring.
Team: Structured the team organization vertically around solutions.
Collaboration: Collaborated with Global Services to create paths from community resources to in-product doc. This is helping drive results and success across product documentation and community.

section.title: Solving Top Customer Issues
section.p: We are having a positive impact on the product. The top documentation-related customer issue in the Get Support area is the request for a documentation one-stop-shop. Clients want more self-sufficiency in product help and support.
The following Key Metrics report shows the dramatic year-over-year rise in how clients are using self-help.

row.entry: Users are seeing more pages and staying on them longer.
Clients are returning to the site at more than twice the rate.
The new help solution is attracting double the amount of unique visitors to product documentation.
Search success - adding search to the Help drop-down and creating a ubiquitous and more effective search is attracting clients.

section.p: Full report at: Key Metrics Report for Marketing Cloud Documentation.

ul.li: Hired Meike Peters to work under Jacob Hammons on the Analytics team.
Analytics: 1.4, Mobile Services 1.0 (rousing feedback!), DTM 1.0, Heartbeat video, iOS/Android/Blackberry Marketing Cloud SDKs, Reporting 1.4 web services (beta), Analytics Firehose (beta)
Social: Re-authored the entire Social Help.
PrimeTime: Integrated PrimeTime help into Marketing Cloud UI and implemented Search&Promote on PrimeTime help.

Target: Authored Bullseye from scratch. Authored the transition guide - a new document type for Marketing Cloud (a combination of clients, PM, dev, consulting, training, and sales to determine content outline).
AEM: Scene7 6.7 and Dynamic Media; S&P 8.11 milestone.
